page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This is traditionally an area of mixed dairy, sheep, poultry and arable farming. It lies mainly in the flat bottom of a natural valley. The high water table leads to some surface flooding in winter. The M4 motorway running through the north of the area gives good access to London, Swindon and Bristol. Since its opening in 1970 it has attracted modern industries to nearby towns, changing the character of the local communities. The main populated area is the village of Sutton Benger, with approx. 1000 people inhabiting some 320 homes. The hamlet of Draycot Cerne with some 30 homes depends on the nearby villages for local facilities. The outskirts of the village of Kington Langley are in the south-west.
